translated: The Perfection of Morality🔽The Birth Story of the King of Swans
a swan wandering in the sky,
with a large body and strong,
On mountain peaks and in mountain caves,
at the foot of trees and in clearings;
on my shoulders, forehead, and beak,
the third and fourth as well;
he defiled me all the time,
the spirit said this to me:
When this was said, O spirit,
‘Why do you mock me with a corpse?
If I were to get angry with him,
I would be worse than he;
and the wise would censure me.
Better to be killed than to live
with a life that is impure;
For what reason should I, even for the sake of life,
he will do the same to others;

translated: and that will be my release.🔽Enduring the low, the middling, and the high,
